pull.title: qt: Treat regtest as testnet
pull.body:
No need to do anything special in the GUI for regtest mode,
but do treat it as testnet not mainnet to prevent confusion.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.body: General ACK, what happened with RPCConsole? Can you post a screen?

Nothing major, it just shows the network name instead of a checkbox.

Why not test it yourself?
I observerd that a screenshot helps getting ACKs without the need to test an uncontroversial pull.

But the point of pull requests is also that people help test them

I always test pulls before merging, but for my own pulls it helps if someone else does it too.
I got the point, often I don't take the time to really test every single Qt-pull, but mainly the "big ones". I'm trying to re-think this and yes, I understand you.

![weird](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1419649/1789211/d6fed8f8-6950-11e3-9ba0-c9e78a12204e.png)

IMHO that new layout looks weird, see the buttons?

Strange...
Going to re-do that change manually in the XML instead of using the UI editor. Looks like it changed around a lot of ancillary stuff.
Ok cleaner change now, thanks for checking.

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/89fc1067718867daeddabcf0a86596b30b74a184 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
If you re-work the 2 nits I can ACK this, GUI is fine now.

events.message:
qt: Treat regtest as testnet

No need to do anything special in the GUI for regtest mode,
but do treat it at testnet not mainnet to prevent confusion.

comments.body: Should this comment be changed everywhere, where we use `SelectParamsFromCommandLine()`? I'm talking about bitcoind.cpp and bitcoin-cli.cpp, I suggest using the same comment there.
Can you remove this new-line, please?
Nah, no need for that. I'll change the comment back.
